verbose: Size of pointer 'ptr' used instead of size of its data. This is likely to lead to a buffer overflow. You probably intend to write 'sizeof(*ptr)'.
warning_message: Size of pointer 'ptr' used instead of size of its data.

verbose: The obsolete function 'gets' is called. With 'gets' you'll get a buffer overrun if the input data exceeds the size of the buffer. It is recommended to use the functions 'fgets' or 'gets_s' instead.
warning_message: Obsolete function 'gets' called. It is recommended to use 'fgets' or 'gets_s' instead.
